title: Where to buy cheap Ray-Ban sunglasses online and how to tell they're real

No sunglasses brand epitomises summer cool like a classic pair of Ray-Bans.

The brand is the go-to make for celebs like Kate Moss, Beyonce - and even our very own royal fashionista, Kate Middleton.

So with spring/summer just around the corner, it's probably time to invest in a nice pair.

Despite the universal appeal some shoppers might be put off by the hefty price tag.

But doing your homework and shopping around can help you snap up a good deal on the iconic fashion accessory. We have also got some extra tips on how to not get ripped off below too.

(Image: Wakeham / Splash News)

Best places to buy Ray-Bans

Here is our round up of some of the best places to buy some cheap Ray-Ban sunglasses online or on the high street.

The sheer volume of stockists featured on the Amazon means you're guaranteed to find competitive prices for a wide range of Ray-Ban styles, including the popular Wayfarer and Aviator styles.

The online designer discount retailer features up to 40% off various styles all year round, dependant on stock availability.

As a certified Ray-Ban dealer the sunglasses specialists is a safe bet for shoppers scared of being scammed.

There's a wide range of styles at good prices and the Sunglasses Shop also offers free delivery and returns too. It's also worth holding out for sale season if you really want to find a bargain.

Sign up to Secret Sales and get access to daily designer sales and dicsounts.

The site has previously featured flash sales of up to 40% off Ray-Ban styles.

Bear with us on this one... While it isn't an obvious choice, if you can find someone with a Costco card, it is worth heading to the wholesale cash and carry and checking out their Ray-Ban sunglasses ranges.

They are often sold at a healthy discount tcompared to the normal RRP all year round.

Online fashion emporium, ASOS, has a great selection of current Ray Ban sunglasses styles for both men and women.

Prices range from £75 to £200, and includes the classic Wayfarer style loved by celebrities.
